title: The Conners EPs Reveal Which Roseanne Characters Will Not Return in Final Season
description: Not everyone is RSVP-ing to The Conners’ going away party. TVLine can confirm that legacy cast members Johnny Galecki (David), Michael Fishman (DJ) and Estelle Parsons (Bev) will not appear during the Roseanne offshoot’s truncated final season, which kicks off with the first of six episodes on Wednesday, March 26 (ABC, 8/7c). “[David is] very […]
author: Ryan Schwartz

title: Elizabeth Olsen to Star in FX Drama Pilot Seven Sisters From Succession Writer
description: Elizabeth Olsen has conjured up her next TV role: The WandaVision star will headline the FX drama pilot Seven Sisters, our sister site Deadline reports. In the project, which has earned a pilot order from FX, “a large, tight-knit family begins to unravel when a sister” played by Olsen “starts communing with a voice no […]
author: Dave Nemetz

title: Crunchyroll Winter 2023 Simulcast Slate Offers Largest Line-Up Yet
description: The Crunchyroll Winter Simulcast 2023 slate is the biggest anime line-up yet, with TRIGUN STAMPEDE, VINLAND SAGA Season 2, and more!
author: Adi Tantimedh

title: Superman & Lois, James Gunn/DCU, Sandman & More: BCTV Daily Dispatch
description: In today's BCTV Daily Dispatch: James Gunn/DCU/Superman/Henry Cavill, Superman & Lois, SNL, The Sandman, The Nevers/#Westworld & tons more!
author: Ray Flook

title: How Social Media and Fan Reaction Have Changed TV and Storytelling
description: Should TV creators, writers, and networks bend to the demands of fans on social media, or should the stay the course? It's a fine line. The post How Social Media and Fan Reaction Have Changed TV and Storytelling appeared first on TV Fanatic.
author: Carissa Pavlica

title: Genre TV Shows That Deserve a Reboot (Because They Had a Great Premise but Failed in Execution)
description: There have been excellent ideas for genre programming over the years, so maybe we can tap that well for unexpected reboots. The post Genre TV Shows That Deserve a Reboot (Because They Had a Great Premise but Failed in Execution) appeared first on TV Fanatic.
author: Carissa Pavlica
